channel.author: Madeaux Podcasts
channel.description:
Menisms is an Urban Popculture Podcast that deals with all things Men. African men in their most vulnerable and completely honest state. Conversations on masculinity, navigating women, emotions, behavioural characteristics and sex amongst other topics. The podcast that answers the age old question, What do men really want?!

Menisms is a "Madeaux Podcasts" Original!

You can watch to our Visual Podcast on YouTube: https://youtu.be/bUt3Bq10e1U

item.dc:creator: Madeaux Podcasts
item.description:
Thank you guys for sticking with us throughout this entire season. We love y'all!


Have you ever found yourself in a serious relationship only to discover that you've dated one of your partner's friends or you just have some secerts from your past?
This episode explores the complex dilemma of whether or not to reveal this information to your partner or not.
We also delve into the potential consequences of keeping secrets and the emotional fallout that can occur when the truth comes to light.


Subscribe to our YouTube channel and watch the video pod on Thursdays here 👉 https://youtube.com/@MenismsPodcast Feel free to drop us a comment. Alté music is a fusion of Afrobeats, Dancehall, Reggae, Hip Hop, and Alternative R&B. The term was coined in the 2010s by Nigerian music group DRB LasGidi, 1meaning alternative and "individualistic and non-traditional modes of self-expression" through music and fashion.

TeeZee, one of the pioneers of the the movement talks about his love for music, DRB, pioneering Alté music in Nigeria, discovering Odumodublvck, fatherhood and more in this fully packed episode. Enjoy!

item.description:
Back with a bang! Our first returning guest, Hausa Chocolate didn't disappoint as she spills the tea on casual sex. Tackling societal norms around casual sex for women, the boys share their hilarious (and relatable) stories of casual sex experiences and asked the tough questions:

How would you approach a woman for casual sex?

👀 Do women still accept it on the first discussion?

Do women still accept first-date casual sex?

The discussion also involved physical vs. emotional attraction and college dating experiences. 📚

item.description:
On this episode, the hosts are joined by a special guest, Olúwádàre Kóláwolé is an expert in human rights, from one of Nigeria’s leading accountability nonprofit organisations “SERAP”. We explored the importance of civic education, understanding of the constitution, and the vital role of transparency and accountability in government. Additionally, we discussed the importance of respecting socio-economic rights as a means of enabling good governance in Nigeria.

item.dc:creator: Madeaux Podcasts
item.description:
Mure and Michael share their own personal stories of breakups, ranging from their experiences as young lovers to navigating breakups in more mature relationships. They share the lessons they learned, the mistakes they made, and the triumphs they experienced on their journey to healing and moving on.

We dive deep into the topic of breakups, explore the different factors that can contribute to a breakup, from communication breakdowns, insecurities, to incompatible values and goals. Throughout the episode, we shared practical advice for getting over a breakup, including the importance of self-reflection, forgiveness, and taking things one day at a time.

item.dc:creator: Madeaux Podcasts
item.description:
We've all had one traumatic experience at one point in our lives. Those experiences have stuck with us for so long and for some maybe even for life. The truth is, trauma hits us in different ways and it's even possible you've had a traumatic experience that's shaping how you react to certain things without you even knowing it. It could be as simple as not being able to jump over a gutter like Olumurwa or an unexplainable fear of sharp objects or fire. What about high school trauma? The bullying and all the drama associated with that stage of life. Or is it the trauma of being a Nigerian or living in Lagos?

Our hosts tell it all in this episode and you definitely don't want to miss it. Don't forget to follow us across all our social media platforms @menismspod and @madeauxhq

For a lot of us, our time in the university was when we got our first whiff of self-discovery. But discovering ourselves is not the only part of this conversation. Looking at our hosts, they're of two very different university backgrounds and each story is relatively different. 

If you are in university or maybe you're done with Uni. When you think back on it, what memories do you have? a lot of good ones? or bad ones? What was your school application process like? did you even have a say in what school you wanted to attend? 

When you eventually got in, what was that like? These are questions that our hosts answer in today's episode. Very relatable guys!

Don't forget to like, subscribe and follow us across all our social media platforms on @menismspod and @madeauxhq

item.dc:creator: Madeaux Podcasts
item.description:
Having to live and exist in Nigeria is honestly quite exhausting. Regardless of the fact that the country does have its perks in some way, the "not so great" outweighs the good. 

In one way or another, Nigeria has come after us in more ways than one. Sometimes similarly or very differently. This week, along with the guys, we have a special guest on our mic, @freshldrb. He joins the guys in discussing the various ways Nigeria has been out to get us all. 

You'd like this one. It hits very close to home. 

As always, make sure to like, subscribe and follow us across all our social media on @menismspod and @madeauxhq

item.dc:creator: Madeaux Podcasts
item.description:
There is no one set in stone rule when it comes to how your relationship with your Nigerian father should be. The conventional Nigerian father is strict and blunt. But not in all cases. Some Nigerian fathers have a father/son and friendship relationship with their kids. But not all. 

How would you describe your relationship with your father? A question to follow that up is; when you tell your father you love him, what does he say? 

This right here, is a lit episode, as you would get to hear several experiences the guys have shared with their father. 

Make sure you like, subscribe, and follow us across all social media on @menismspod and @madeauxhq

item.dc:creator: Madeaux Podcasts
item.description:
Everyone experiences some form of post-nut clarity. It could either be of a negative impact or a positive one. Post-nut clarity is a form of realization or closure that comes to you immediately after you bust a nut. This now brings up the thoughts of whether it was a worthy nut or not. Would you like to have this feeling again? or is it a one and done?

Maybe you didn't know what it was at the time, but after this episode, you're definitely going to have things in perspective. 

Don't forget to like, subscribe and follow us on all our social media platforms on @menismspod and @madeauxhq

item.dc:creator: Madeaux Podcasts
item.description:
Finding yourself might sound like a very cliché narrative. But not knowing who you are shapes the life decisions you make, your relationships, your personal life and even work life. You can't be your best self and give your best to those around you if you don't know what your best is and who you are. 

It's important to understand yourself, what you like and don't like. A lot of men don't know who they are and it tells in everything they do. 

Be sure to follow us across all our social media on @menismspod and @madeauxhq.

item.dc:creator: Madeaux Podcasts
item.description:
Society has a perception of what the ideal Nigerian man should be like, and how much he should have in his bank account. Sometimes it's hard being a man because there is so much pressure on who should be and how much you should have by the time you're 30. It's just so exhausting sometimes, you know?  

@olumurewa and @sonariwoondeck give us a breakdown in this episode and let us know how a man really feels with these pressures. We'll tell you one thing, it's a packed episode. 

To watch this episode on YouTube, head on to our channel: MadeauxHQ, and follow us on Instagram, Twitter, and TikTok @menismspod!

Menisms is a "Madeaux Podcasts" Original!
